shortdesc.ph: Destroys the audio and video recording object.

section.p: When you no longer need to record audio/video streams, you can call this method to destroy the corresponding recording object. If recording is in progress, call first to stop recording, and then call this method to destroy the recording object.

When you no longer need to record audio/video streams, you can call this method to destroy the corresponding recording object. If recording is in progress, call first to stop recording, and then call this method to destroy the recording object.

When you no longer need to record audio and video streams, you can call this method to destroy the corresponding media recorder object. If recording is in progress, call first to stop recording, and then call this method to destroy the media recorder object.

When you no longer need to record audio and video streams, call this method to destroy the corresponding recording object. If you are currently recording, stop recording with before calling this method.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
